It's not really surprising how the united states doesn't want to cooperate with China. A lot of the science, techniques and materials developed for space flight are also applicable in a number of military uses. Geo politically they're considered rivals and they simply don't want to hand out those kinds of capabilities to a foreign power that's not firmly in their camp. That said there's nothing wrong with cheering them on as they make their own discoveries and figure out their own path to the stars in the name of peaceful exploration.

Tianwen is the title of a poem written by Qu Yuan ,  a great patriotic poet in ancient China ,deeply loved and respected by the Chinese people.   Reading this poem, you will be astonished by its amazing imagination and profound philosophy，It expresses the exploration and knowledge of the universe，It is perfectly in harmony with China's current space exploration project，this name represents the romance of Chinese scientists，Tianwen -1 represents China's first Mars probe，It will reach Mars orbit after more than half a year's flight，So，God speed

Tianwen, means “the inquires of Universe”. It is the name of a poem written 2500 years ago. The Chinese poetry asked hundreds of questions regarding Universe: how was the universe created, who created the universe, what was the state of the universe before it was created, etc. Imagine ancient people looking at the sky, eager to find out the answers. 34:38 No, Chinese Space Program (China Aerospace Bureau) is not part of “Chinese Rocket Army” - which is the branch operating ICBM and IRBMs in PLA. That said the nature of aerospace industry is matter of national security. So far United States is the only nation have a “space force” (its a shame, we tried to avoid militarize the space since the 70’s... and it still happened. Let’s hope US won’t put satellites with missiles in the space anytime soon)
Why China wasn’t allowed to work on ISS? Simple: politics. US congress had explicitly prohibit NASA cooperate with the Chinese citing “human rights violation” ( “no tax money should be used cooperate with Chinese scientists,”...) China came to NASA offered to help building the ISS, and before the Congress ruling, NASA was going to let them help... ISS could finish at least a year or two earlier...

Why can’t you support China’s missions? How is it not awesome? If the launch fails, China doesn’t share their data. They don’t help other engineers improve. Plus, in 1996 when their rocket crashed (killing hundreds) they stole sensitive western rocket tech when the USA went to help them (see wiki for links). They are in it for themselves, and they don’t support the community of space exploration.

It’s name is Tian Wen - 1 , Tian literally means Sky , but Chinese uses it for the same meaning of God as Chinese don’t use other word for God though there are many words means God or Godness. Chinese use the word “Tian”, which means “sky” in general to mean God. But here, this “Tian” only means Sky. “Wen” means “ask” for direct translate. So, Tian Wen literally means Sky Ask or Ask the Sky. Chinese space station called Tian Gong - Sky Palace to direct translate , means Space Palace. Tian Wen also derive from ancient China one of most famous person - Qu Yuan’s poem, with same title Tian Wen. Qu Yuan, the “rice dumpling festival”  or “Duan Wu Festival” is to commemorate him. His poem is in ancient Chinese literature, and talks about the beginning of the world, natural phenomena, tian, earth (Di), Human and life . It’s a good piece of Chines literature

I wonder if the slight outward angle of the booster exhaust is by design in order to prevent under-expansion of the exhaust of the central hydrogen-based engine. Perhaps that engine has a larger nozzle, designed for more efficiency at higher altitudes, and having the boosters pointing straight down might create  artificial high-pressure around that nozzle, causing under-expansion and instability in the nozzle... so slanting them outward slightly might actually give them the ability to get more efficiency out of the center engine and actually be an efficiency gain!
